private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D only (A is smallest, D is largest among these).
I can only move a disk if it is currently the top disk on a peg.
I must respect standard Tower of Hanoi stacking rules: no larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration is: left peg (top->bottom) D,E,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg (top->bottom) A,B; right peg (top->bottom) C.

private_information: I can move disks E, F, G only (E is smallest among these).
I can only move a disk if it is currently the top disk on a peg.
I must respect standard Tower of Hanoi stacking rules: no larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration is: left peg (top->bottom) D,E,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg (top->bottom) A,B; right peg (top->bottom) C.

private_information: I can move disks H, I, J only (H is smallest among these, J is largest overall).
I can only move a disk if it is currently the top disk on a peg.
I must respect standard Tower of Hanoi stacking rules: no larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration is: left peg (top->bottom) D,E,F,G,H,I,J; middle peg (top->bottom) A,B; right peg (top->bottom) C.

private_information: I coordinate the three agents and integrate their proposed moves into a valid global plan.
My output must include a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver and an ordered list of primitive moves in the requested textual format.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a validated global plan that achieves the target configuration and produce the PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards plus the final ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

public_information: Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk moved at a time; only the top disk on a peg may be moved; a disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top->bottom) A, B; right peg has (top->bottom) C.
Agent disk movement restrictions: agent_1 may move A,B,C,D; agent_2 may move E,F,G; agent_3 may move H,I,J.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You are restricted to moving disks A, B, C, D only. You know the public environment information and your private constraints. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform given the current state and your restriction. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are allowed to perform and that respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not emit PDDL.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Think step by step and output the minimal ordered list of primitive moves you propose, formatted as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you cannot determine a necessary move because of missing information, only output moves that are unambiguous from your perspective.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You are restricted to moving disks E, F, G only. You know the public environment information and your private constraints. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform given the current state and your restriction. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are allowed to perform and that respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not emit PDDL.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Think step by step and output the minimal ordered list of primitive moves you propose, formatted as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you cannot determine a necessary move because of missing information, only output moves that are unambiguous from your perspective.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You are restricted to moving disks H, I, J only. You know the public environment information and your private constraints. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you can perform given the current state and your restriction. Each move must be formatted exactly as: 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Only include moves you are allowed to perform and that respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not emit PDDL.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Think step by step and output the minimal ordered list of primitive moves you propose, formatted as 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you cannot determine a necessary move because of missing information, only output moves that are unambiguous from your perspective.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator coordinating three agents in a multi-agent Tower of Hanoi problem. Your job is to integrate the agents' proposed primitive moves into a valid global plan, ensure all Tower of Hanoi constraints are respected, and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver. Additionally, produce the final ordered list of primitive moves in the exact textual format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions distinct per agent (do not merge agent identities).
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Public information: {environment->public_information}. You will receive the move proposals from the three agents: {moves_agent_1}, {moves_agent_2}, {moves_agent_3}. Integrate these proposals, resolve ambiguities, and produce: 1) a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the three agents and the Tower of Hanoi instance for FastDownwards, with actions kept distinct per agent; 2) the final validated ordered list of primitive moves that achieves the target configuration, each line formatted exactly as 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. If you must modify or reorder agent proposals to satisfy the rules and achieve the goal, explain the minimal changes within the PDDL problem or as brief comments adjacent to the move list. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
